fields.description:
When I installed pyarrow 0.16, some parquet files created with pyarrow 0.15.1 would make python crash. I drilled down to the simplest example I could find.

It happens that some parquet files created with pyarrow 0.16 cannot either be read back. The example below works fine with arrays_ok but python crashes with arrays_nok (and as soon as they are at least three different values apparently).

Besides, it works fine with 'none', 'gzip' and 'brotli' compression. The problem seems to happen only with snappy.
{code:python}
import pyarrow.parquet as pq
import pyarrow as pa
arrays_ok = [[0,1]]
arrays_ok = [[0,1,1]]
arrays_nok = [[0,1,2]]
table = pa.Table.from_arrays(arrays_nok,names=['a'])
pq.write_table(table,'foo.parquet',compression='snappy')
pq.read_table('foo.parquet')
{code}
fields.summary: [Python] crashes when reading parquet file compressed with snappy

comments.body:
[~marcbernot] Thanks for the report!

Can you give a bit more details on the environment you experience this with? 
I just tried with conda-forge (clean environment with {{ conda create -n arrow-016 ipython pyarrow=0.16}} with everything from conda-forge on Ubuntu), and the above snippet does not give any error for me. Might be a windows problem then.

Indeed I tried this with macOS and this did not give any error. This seems Windows specific.

I checked if the generated foo.parquet files were exactly the same on Windows and macOS and they are. 

I experienced this on two separate windows environments.
 * Windows 10 family 64bits, intel Atom x5-Z8500 CPU @1,44GHz
 As you did, I started from a clean miniconda environment then \{{ conda create -c conda-forge -n arrow-3x016 python=3.x pyarrow=0.16}} with x=6,7,8 

 * 
 ** all these python versions result in the same crash
 * Windows 7, 64bits, HPZ820 workstation, intel Xeon CPU E5-2630
 ** here I tested only python=3.6.9

Would other informations on my environment be useful?
Someone should take a quick look at this on a Windows machine before the 0.17.0 backlog closes to see if there are any clues
I'll try to look at this tomorrow to see if I can learn something about what's up
I could not reproduce under Windows 7 64-bit, with pyarrow 0.16.0 from conda-forge.
I can't reproduce on Windows 10 64-bit with the conda-forge nightly, nor with the 0.16.0 wheel. I recommend we close as a cannot reproduce
Please re-open if you can give us another reproducer to try

Hello,

I just faced the same issue with pyarrow 0.17.1 installed from conda-forge on Windows 7 64 bit with Python 3.8.3.

The example code given in description crash with array_nok and compression='snappy' but not with other compression algorithms nor with array_ok. Works fine with pyarrow 0.15.1

I also tried with a clean environment as suggested in first comment (pyarrow 0.16) and the problem is the same.

I tried to open the generated parquet files (that can't be read by pyarrow, compression='snappy') with [fastparquet |https://github.com/dask/fastparquet] or [ParquetViewer|https://github.com/mukunku/ParquetViewer]: They both can't read the parquet file...

What additionnal information could I give you?
Also tried with a nightly build and the same crash happens

[~n-elie] I'm pretty sure this is caused by https://github.com/conda-forge/snappy-feedstock/issues/24 cc [~uwe] 

If you switch to the wheels from {{pip}} does the problem go away?

So I created a new virtual environment with just ipython from conda and then installed pyarrow from pip. This results in the following errror when the sample code is run:

{code:python}
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
AttributeError                            Traceback (most recent call last)
~\AppData\Local\Continuum\miniconda3\envs\arrow\lib\site-packages\pyarrow\pandas-shim.pxi in pyarrow.lib._PandasAPIShim._check_import()

~\AppData\Local\Continuum\miniconda3\envs\arrow\lib\site-packages\pyarrow\pandas-shim.pxi in pyarrow.lib._PandasAPIShim._import_pandas()

AttributeError: module 'pandas' has no attribute '__version__'
Exception ignored in: 'pyarrow.lib._PandasAPIShim._have_pandas_internal'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "pyarrow\pandas-shim.pxi", line 107, in pyarrow.lib._PandasAPIShim._check_import
  File "pyarrow\pandas-shim.pxi", line 54, in pyarrow.lib._PandasAPIShim._import_pandas
AttributeError: module 'pandas' has no attribute '__version__'{code}


However, when using pyarrow from conda, the crash happens with 0.17.1 and 0.16 and not with 0.15.1 even though snappy is the same version (1.1.8)

What processor does your machine have? If you can produce a backtrace with Visual Studio that would help us determine where the crash is coming from. It sounds like it's a processor feature support issue related to the build flags used with conda-forge
As [~uwe] noted, I have the same issue, accidentally created a new issue for it here https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-9229

If this helps, I tried to reproduce the bug on several windows machine with the same conda/python environment on an external harddrive.

The bug was there with the two processors (no AVX2) mentionned earlier in the discussion.

However on a laptop with intel Core i5-4300M @ 2.6GHz (AVX2 instructions) there was no bug.
This will almost certainly be fixed by https://github.com/conda-forge/snappy-feedstock/pull/26

The conda-forge patch was just merged

https://github.com/conda-forge/snappy-feedstock/commit/5b7b850667c769df4551c81dc8ffaef76e8d371b

Please wait a while for the package to update and please confirm that the issue is resolved with the new snappy 1.1.8 package
I can confirm that the fix works on my computer

I can confirm, works for me as well now on a processor that doesn't support AVX2 / BMI2 instructions (Intel64 Family 6 Model 45 Stepping 7) and had previously crashed with this, so appears to be fixed. Just tested with Snappy 1.1.8 build #3 in conda-forge.

We seem to be facing the same crash with the sample code here, but with the pyarrow 2.0.0 pip wheel for Windows and Python 3.8.
On an Intel Xeon Silver 4114 CPU, I have no issues.
On an Intel Xeon E5-2620, my Python crashes.

According to https://ark.intel.com/content/www/us/en/ark/products/64594/intel-xeon-processor-e5-2620-15m-cache-2-00-ghz-7-20-gt-s-intel-qpi.html, the Xeon E5-2620, does not support AVX2, while the other one does, so I suspect we are hitting the same issue here.

Assuming this is the same issue, has this snappy fix been including in the pyarrow pip wheel build for Windows?
[~mpeleshenko] Can you try with the nightly wheels? See https://arrow.apache.org/docs/python/install.html#installing-nightly-packages

[~apitrou] I'm testing on Windows 10 and the latest nightly wheel I see is pyarrow-2.1.0.dev48 while linux wheels go all the way to dev 581. It worked fine on my Xeon Silver so far. I'll let you know the results of my colleague's test with his Xeon E5 tomorrow.
Oh, you're right, we need to apply the patch. I misunderstood that Snappy 1.1.8 was fixed :-(
[~apitrou] Should I create another JIRA to track patching the wheel build?
[~mpeleshenko] It should already be done now: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/9096/files#diff-9ad0d6bbe849c2154feb10cd87f1be85ebf54001fa00ec25d428730609b3d158
